resources.string: The First Aid box should be a water resistant, leak proof, air tight and drop resistant container , with numerous compartments for separating medicines etc.
Know what all medications are in box and how to use it.
Train others,even kids in your family to use the kit. You may be the one who needs first aid.
The best place to keep your aid kit is the kitchen. The bathroom has too much humidity, which sometimes shortens the shelf life of items.

CPR may be necessary for an adult or children during many different emergencies , including accidents, near drowning, suffocation, poisoning, smoke inhalation, electrocution injuries, and suspected Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS).
It should only be performed when a person is not breathing or circulating blood adequately.
After CPR , You find an obvious sign of life, e.g.breathing.

ANIMAL BITES - Apply direct pressure until bleeding stops. Gently clean with with soap / antiseptic liquid and warm water. Rinse for several minutes after cleaning. Apply antibiotic cream to reduce risk of infection, and cover with a sterile bandage.

BROKEN BONE - If the injury and pain is serious then call the ambulance or doctor at once. Do not move the broken bone unnecessarily. Place soft padding (clothing, blankets etc.). Continue support until help arrives.

BURNS - Cool the burn under cool running water for at least 10 minutes. The faster and longer a burn is cooled, the less the impact of the injury. If the burn require further require care, try to cover it (e.g. with plastic wrap or cover or any ideal covering which does not stick to the burn). This will prevent infection by keeping the area clean.
